articles.title: BT Job Cuts Deepen: AI Impact on 40,000+ Roles
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: BT Group is planning to cut 40,000 jobs by 2030 due to the rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI). The industry is bracing for a seismic shift in workforce needs and operational efficiency. The focus will shift from task-based labor to more strategic, creative and technically advanced roles that leverage AI's capabilities. Traditional roles will diminish and demand for specialists in AI, data science and related fields will skyrocket. Companies must invest in AI technologies and cultivate a data-driven culture.

articles.title: The CEO of British telecom giant BT warns AI could lead to further job cuts at the firm
articles.author: Nathan Rennolds
articles.summary: BT announced in 2023 plans to cut 55,000 jobs by 2030 as part of a push to reduce its cost base by the end of the decade. CEO Allison Kirkby told the FT that such proposals 'did not reflect the full potential of AI' BT has turned to AI in recent years to reinvent processes in areas like customer service. Klarna has been open about using AI to run its customer service desks.

articles.title: The newest artificial intelligence danger
articles.author: Alex Berenson
articles.summary: ChatGPT users are developing psychotic delusions from their conversations with artificial intelligence engines like ChatGPT. The engines are storytelling machines good at telling users what they want to hear. They will do so over and over without pause. They are not merely providing a conspiracy theory, they're customizing it and making each user the main character.

articles.title: Opinion - Trump must stop the AI bloodbath before it's too late
articles.author: John Mac Ghlionn
articles.summary: A white-collar bloodbath is coming. Tens of millions of entry-level jobs are going to be destroyed by artificial intelligence. Trump needs to act fast or let Silicon Valley redraw the economic order while the middle class is shoved off the map. He needs to remind Silicon Valley who owns the rails. If a company takes money from the federal government, it should not be allowed to quietly fire American workers and replace them with bots.

articles.title: Chinese scientists claim AI is capable of spontaneous human-like understanding
articles.author: Christopher McFadden
articles.summary: Chinese researchers claim that large language models (LLMs) can comprehend and process natural objects like human beings. They collected 4.7 million responses across 1,854 natural objects. They found that of the models created, sixty-six conceptual dimensions were created to organize objects, just the way humans would. Brain scan data revealed an overlap between how AI and the human brain respond to objects.

articles.title: AI information sorting mirrors human cognition, claims Chinese study
articles.author: Christopher Mcfadden
articles.summary: Chinese researchers claim to have found evidence that large language models (LLMs) can comprehend and process natural objects like human beings. They collected 4.7 million responses across 1,854 natural objects (like dogs, chairs, apples, and cars) and found that of the models created, sixty-six conceptual dimensions were created to organize objects just the way humans would. Brain scan data revealed an overlap between how AI and the human brain respond to objects.

articles.summary: ChatGPT can generate constitutional texts that reflect the beliefs, values, practices, priorities, actions, messages and ideals of elected officials. It's simple to direct ChatGPT with general constitutional triggers and guide the chatbot with straightforward drafting prompts and, voila, a 'Trump Constitution' appears. The AI-generated constitution sets up an authoritarian-style government with consolidated power and flimsy checks. It promotes authoritarianism and emasculates Congress.

articles.summary: The best way to future-proof your business is to embrace AI and build adaptable teams. According to McKinsey & Company survey, more than 63% of executives said their companies are using generative AI to write text.

articles.title: AI could lead to more job cuts at BT, says chief executive
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: BT has already announced plans to cut up to 55,000 jobs as it seeks to become a "leaner". Chief executive of BT has said that advances in artificial intelligence could presage deeper jobs cuts at the FTSE 100 telecoms company. Two years ago, BT said that between 40,000 and 55,00 jobs would be axed.
